benchmark_details.name: SAGI Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: The SAGI Benchmark is designed to evaluate speech LLMs across various tasks that represent the characteristics of different levels of speech understanding, from basic ASR to advanced capabilities integrating non-semantic information and abstract acoustic knowledge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a structured benchmark for evaluating the capabilities of speech LLMs across five defined levels of speech understanding.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark currently does not cover certain advanced tasks associated with Level 4 and Level 5.

data.source: Various publicly available datasets including LibriSpeech, RA VDESS, and others as detailed in the paper.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as WER are calculated by comparing ASR outputs to reference text. Accuracy is measured by the percentage of correct responses in objective tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in recognition and understanding tasks.
methodology.validation: Reliability of evaluation sets was verified using human tests.
